subject: Technology
title: URLs: Addresses for Everything
description: A short lesson to help you apply URLs: Addresses for Everything.

hook.text: If the web is a city, every page needs an address. Without one, you can never find anything.

buildup.text: Before URLs, finding a file on a network meant knowing the exact server name and path.

discovery.text: Berners-Lee created the URL: a universal address format that works for any resource online.

twist.text: He later said the double slash in 'http://' was unnecessary. He wished he had left it out.

climax.text: Despite that regret, URLs gave every page on earth a unique, shareable location.

punchline.text: A URL is just a street address for the internet.

quiz.question: What is a URL?
options: A universal address for any resource online
